total_revenue.fx_impact: Currency headwind of 3% on revenue and $0.05 negative on EPS due to strengthened USD

Cloud_Services_and_License_Support.context: Cloud Services and License Support revenues account for 73% of total company revenue

Cloud_License_and_On-Premise_License.context: Cloud License and On-Premise License revenues were $2.5 billion, up 18% in USD and up 25% in constant currency

Fusion_Apps.context: Fusion applications revenues were up 24% in constant currency

Fusion_ERP.context: Fusion ERP Cloud Revenue up 20% in USD and up 23% in constant currency

NetSuite_ERP.context: NetSuite ERP Cloud Revenue up 27% in USD and up 30% in constant currency

Gen2_Cloud_and_Autonomous_Database.context: OCI consumption revenue, including Autonomous Database, was up 47% in constant currency

Cloud_Customer_Revenue.context: Revenue from cloud customers was up 43%

Database_Subscription_Revenue.context: Database subscription revenues, including support and data-based cloud services, were up 3% in USD and up 5% in constant currency

key_factors: Investments to meet growing demand for cloud services

COGS.context: Cost of Goods Sold details not explicitly provided in the transcript

gross_margin.context: Gross margin for Cloud Services and License Support in Q4 2022

gross_profit.context: Gross profit dollars for Cloud Services and License Support grew by 4% in constant currency

gaap.context: GAAP operating income for Q4 2022, down 1% in USD and up 6% in constant currency

non_gaap.context: Non-GAAP operating income for Q4 2022, up 3% in USD and up 8% in constant currency
Non-GAAP Net Income for Q4 2022, up 2% year-over-year

gaap.context: GAAP Earnings Per Share for Q4 2022

non_gaap.context: Non-GAAP Earnings Per Share for Q4 2022, up 14% in USD and up 1% in constant currency

context: Assumes a base tax rate of 19%
One-time tax events may cause actual tax rates to vary
Expected to average around 19% for fiscal year 2022

operating_cash_flow.context: Operating cash flow over the trailing twelve months

capital_expenditures.context: Capital expenditures over the trailing twelve months

free_cash_flow.context: Free cash flow over the trailing twelve months

capital_expenditures.context: Capital expenditures over the trailing twelve months

share_repurchase.context: Repurchased 8 million shares for a total of $600 million in Q4

dividends.context: Declared a quarterly dividend of $0.32 per share, paid $3.5 billion over the last 12 months

share_repurchase_authorization.context: Increased authorization for share repurchases by $10 billion

Fusion_and_Autonomous_Database.description: Continued growth and advancements in Fusion ERP, Fusion HCM, and the Autonomous Database
initiatives: Upgrading legacy systems to Fusion ERP and Fusion HCM
Expanding the Autonomous Database customer base
Enhancing security and reducing human error with autonomous technologies
Integrating Oracle MySQL with Heat Wave across multiple public clouds
Making Oracle MySQL with HeatWave available on other public clouds
Launching new cloud-based applications for banking and healthcare
Developing cloud-based National Electronic Health Records (EHR) Database and Public Health Management Applications
Integrating Cerner applications into Oracle Cloud
goals: Become the largest back-office applications provider
Increase recurring revenue through cloud services
Prevent data theft and reduce operational costs with autonomous technologies
Achieve widespread adoption of Oracle MySQL with Heat Wave
Expand OCI capacity to meet growing demand
Enhance cloud portfolio with edge infrastructure and health management solutions
Deliver transformative healthcare solutions through Cerner integration
examples: Bank of America going live on Oracle Fusion ERP
Macquarie, the largest investment bank in Australia, going live with Oracle Fusion ERP
Vanguard going live with Oracle Fusion ERP
Strategic partnerships with HSBC, Bank New York Mellon, JPMorgan Chase
Development of new cloud B2B financing and payment systems with banking partners
Healthcare wins including UnitedHealthcare, NHS, WellSpan, Pfizer
Financial services wins including Citibank, Chubb, PNC, SMBC

Autonomous_Database.description: Introduction and expansion of Oracle Autonomous Database as a game changer in cloud services
initiatives: Automating database configuration, patching, backup, and encryption
Preventing human error to enhance data security
Promoting Autonomous Database to non-Oracle customers
Integrating Autonomous Database with other Oracle Cloud services
Making Oracle MySQL with Heat Wave available on multiple public clouds
Adding OCI capacity and building new data centers
Launching Oracle Database 21c with over 200 new features
Expanding Oracle Roving Edge Infrastructure for secure, scalable cloud services in remote areas
Developing MySQL HeatWave as a multicloud product available on Oracle Cloud, AWS, and Azure
goals: Differentiate second-generation cloud from first-generation cloud
Reduce operational costs by eliminating human labor
Prevent data theft and catastrophic data loss
Achieve widespread adoption across various industries
Compete aggressively with Amazon Aurora, Redshift, and Snowflake
Ensure scalable infrastructure to support growing demand
Reinforce Oracle's converged database strategy with Oracle Database 21c
examples: MySQL HeatWave available on Oracle Public Cloud, AWS, and Azure
Customers measuring Oracle's MySQL to be 100x faster than Amazon Aurora for query processing
Oracle MySQL with HeatWave outperforming Amazon Aurora and Redshift
Snowflake's competitive data warehouse solutions being outperformed by Oracle's offerings

revenue_growth.expectation: Healthy bookings growth with continued demand for hybrid and cloud offerings
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Expected to grow between 5% to 7% in Q4 2021
revenue_growth.fx_impact: Currency movements expected to have a minor positive impact on total revenues and EPS
factors: Growth in Oracle Cloud consumption and long-term contracts
Accelerating growth rate expected to continue fiscal year 2021
Expansion of OCI capacity to meet growing demand
Continued adoption of Fusion ERP and NetSuite ERP

eps_growth.context: Non-GAAP EPS growth in constant currency and USD, adjusted for currency headwind

drivers: Investments in GitHub and Citus Data acquisitions
Continued investment in AI and commercial sales capacity
Aggressive investment in OCI capacity and data center expansion

focus: Development of Oracle Roving Edge Infrastructure

revenue_growth.context: Total revenue expected to grow between 20% to 22% in constant currency and 17% to 19% in USD, including Cerner

cloud_service_and_license_support_growth.context: Cloud service and license support revenue expected to grow between 25% to 28% in constant currency and 22% to 25% in USD, excluding Cerner

cloud_revenue_including_cerner.context: Total cloud revenue including Cerner expected to grow between 47% to 50% in constant currency and 44% to 47% in USD

eps_growth.context: Non-GAAP EPS for Q1 expected to grow between 6% and 10% in constant currency and between 1% and 5% in USD
assumptions: One-time tax events could cause actual tax rates to vary

currency_impact.description: Currency should have a 3% to 4% negative impact on total revenue and $0.05 to $0.06 negative effect on EPS in Q1
currency_impact.context: Assuming currency exchange rates remain the same as they are now

metadata.source: Q4 2022 Earnings Call Transcript and Press Release
operating_environment_challenges: Impact of COVID-19 on global operations
Currency fluctuations affecting revenue and EPS
Managing integration of acquisitions and investments
Scaling cloud infrastructure to meet growing demand
Ensuring data security with Autonomous Database
Capacity constraints in OCI leading to rapid expansion
Competition with other cloud providers like AWS, Microsoft, and Google
Maintaining high customer retention rates amidst aggressive growth
